image.altText: A mugshot of Mark-Bry Leedham.

props.synopsis: The family of a murder victim has welcomed a life sentence imposed on one of his killers, while expressing outrage that a different man previously convicted over his death has been moved to a low-security facility.

title.children: Man jailed for at least 28 years over murder 'does not deserve to be in society', victim's family says

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of Bryce Cotton wearing his red Perth Wildcats uniform during an NBL game.

props.synopsis: NBL side the Adelaide 36rs are set to announce a momentous signing, with league superstar and five-time MVP Bryce Cotton to join the club.

title.children: NBL superstar Bryce Cotton set to sign with 36ers

image.altText: a border collie dog walking through long grass or weeds

props.synopsis: So-called conservation detection dogs are being trialled in the Riverland and Murraylands to find elusive, but once thriving, Murray Darling carpet pythons.

title.children: Sending in dogs to sniff out a snake growing thin on the ground

image.altText: A man in a black T-shirt affectionately holds his one-eyed cat under the chin

props.synopsis: Michael thought he would have to surrender his beloved cat when he was suddenly hit with a big emergency vet bill. Experts say many Australians are taking on debts through high-interest loan schemes or making the heartbreaking decision to euthanise their pets.

title.children: Debt, death or surrender: The impossible choice faced by cash-strapped pet owners

image.altText: A woman in a floral shirt

props.synopsis: Whyalla City Council will make an application to impose a city-wide dry zone after receiving anecdotal reports of an increase in alcohol-fuelled violence.

title.children: Regional SA council votes in favour of city-wide dry zone

image.altText: Hands reach to grab two cocktails off bar grate at a bar.

props.synopsis: For a long time, drinking has been seen as a rite of passage for young Australians, but that's changing.

title.children: 'It's poison': Why Gen Z is turning away from alcohol

image.altText: Visitors walk towards Dingley Dell, a white heritage cottage surrounded by greenery, with signage visible in the foreground

props.synopsis: A former dot-com millionaire's plan to install glamping tents at Adam Lindsay Gordon's cottage is opposed by fans of the 19th-century poet.

title.children: Fans of 19th-century poet fight former tech millionaire's glamping bid

image.altText: SA Water

props.synopsis: Developers and SA Water cannot agree on how to divvy up the cost of new pipes, leaving the future of more than 1,000 homes outside Adelaide shrouded in uncertainty.

title.children: More than 1,000 homes in limbo as SA Water money dries up

image.altText: Three men sitting on a cliff overlooking rocks and ocean

props.synopsis: A group of volunteers who helped end plans for a 156-room casino resort near sea lion habitat in South Australia's Chain of Bays celebrate two decades of work to preserve the region's precious ecosystems.

title.children: Eco-warriors who halted casino near sea lion sanctuary mark 20 years

image.altText: Roia Atmar holds a framed photo of her three  young children

props.synopsis: Mother-of-four Roia Atmar says that her husband burned her in a bid to disfigure her so "nobody else would look at me". Researchers say domestic burns violence cases like hers are often under-reported for reasons including fear and shame.

title.children: Domestic violence burns cases 'reasonably common' researchers say

image.altText: An elderly man in a jumper smiles for a family photo

props.synopsis: A coroner recommends transport authorities better utilise their discretion to suspend the licences of at-risk drivers, following the death of an 86-year-old on South Australia's Karoonda Highway in 2019.

title.children: Death of elderly driver in SA highway crash prompts push for change

image.altText: A man standing in front of his green car.

props.synopsis: Tyler Redway got a licence after passing driving tests in his own vehicle modified to his needs. But there are concerns that, under new rules, people like him will no longer be able to do that.

title.children: Change to obtaining SA drivers licences set to impact people with disability

image.altText: Torrens Island power station

props.synopsis: SafeWork SA has lodged criminal proceedings against energy giant AGL alleging the company exposed workers to "unsafe levels of lead" at its Torrens Island plant.

title.children: Charges laid against AGL over 'unsafe' lead exposure

image.altText: An elderly man walks down the corridor of a secure ward in Sunshine Hospital.

props.synopsis: The TGA has approved a drug found to slow the cognitive decline associated with Alzheimer's disease but it will only be available for a select few who can afford it privately.

title.children: First drug to target cause of Alzheimer's approved for use in Australia

image.altText: Cows wearing electronic collars graze in green pasture

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will develop regulations to support virtual fencing for cattle, bringing the state further in line with others across Australia.

title.children: Virtual fencing one step closer for most of Australia's dairy herd

image.altText: Four people smiling and hugging

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed two bodies, believed to be those of missing people, have been recovered from floodwaters on the Mid North Coast today. Further south at Moto, residents say they are devastated by the loss of Mr Knowles, whose body was found on Wednesday.

title.children: Third body found in floodwaters as tributes flow for 'selfless hero' David Knowles

image.altText: David Littleproud and Sussan Ley during QT

props.synopsis: The Liberals and Nationals have taken their first step towards reconciliation, just two days after their bombshell break-up, with both party leaders delaying planned announcements about their respective frontbench line-ups.

title.children: Two days after bombshell break-up, Liberals and Nationals return to negotiating table

image.altText: Intubated and in a coma

props.synopsis: An Australian tourist who was rushed to hospital after drinking a pina colada at a popular Fiji resort says she is convinced she was "poisoned" by tainted alcohol.

title.children: Susan had two sips of a pina colada. Hours later, she was in a coma

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou holds his hand on his chest

props.synopsis: When Spurs hired Ange Postecoglou, he was seen as an alternative to the "winners" who had gone before him. Now he's backed up his pre-season statement of always winning a trophy in his second season to silence the doubters. Again.

title.children: Ange knew he was a 'serial winner' when he went to Spurs. Now they do too

image.altText: A composite image showing about a dozen photos of Norman Swan.

props.synopsis: A fake Norman Swan is spruiking unproven supplements and weight loss products online, and people are falling for it. The real Norman Swan feels powerless to stop it.

title.children: Adele is offering weight loss drugs spruiked by deepfake Norman Swan

image.altText: A flooded river

props.synopsis: Torrential falls will continue right through Thursday across the already flooded Mid North Coast catchments, with the potential for a fourth consecutive day of totals well above 100 millimetres.

title.children: Flooding rains in NSW to become more widespread, tracking south to Sydney

image.altText: albanese close up

props.synopsis: Research shows voters want the government to seize the moment after its landslide win and do something big.

title.children: Out of the wreckage on the other side, Albanese has a rare shot

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann being filmed as he arrives at the Toowoomba courthouse

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyers have complained about not receiving evidence during the latest court hearing over an alleged rape in Toowoomba.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyers claim 'shroud of secrecy' over rape case

image.altText: Tom Cruise stands at the foot of a mountain with four people looking tense behind him

props.synopsis: Teaming up again with director Christopher McQuarrie, Tom Cruise is embodying Ethan Hunt for one final time (allegedly) in Mission: Impossible — The Final Reckoning. And this time, the enemy is a little more existential.

title.children: Mission: Impossible — The Final Reckoning shows it's time to say goodbye

image.altText: A Boeing aircraft flies in the sky

props.synopsis: Retrofitting the 13-year-old plane will require significant security upgrades, communications improvements to prevent spies from listening in and the ability to fend off incoming missiles, experts say.

title.children: US Air Force to spend $1.5 billion retro-fitting gifted Qatari plane for Trump use

image.altText: A red chart tracking stocks falling

props.synopsis: The local share market has closed in the red after US stocks dropped and there was tepid demand for US government bonds, a reflection of investor nerves over Donald Trump's "big, beautiful bill".

title.children: ASX follows Wall Street lower as US bond sell-off deepens — as it happened

image.altText: Man wearing military gear holds gun and stands next to armoured vehicle

props.synopsis: A delegation of diplomats and officials from European, Asian and Arab countries were forced to run when Israeli forces opened fire in the city of Jenin.

title.children: Israeli forces open fire on 25 diplomats including UK, Canada in West Bank tour

image.altText: Cyril Ramaphosa holds up a finger as Donald Trump speaks.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump confronts his South African counterpart over violence inflicted on white farmers in his country, in an at-times heated White House meeting reminiscent of the February clash involving Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

title.children: Trump clashes with Ramaphosa in another televised Oval Office stoush

image.altText: Composite image of Chris Griffin and Laura Henshaw by Morgan

props.synopsis: An Australian podcaster's desire for a partner who does not "complain" about her day and instead offers "peace and love" to support his ambitions has sparked discussions about the resurgence of traditional gender norms.

title.children: Podcaster defends gender comments that sparked outrage from women

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Investigators say public information is "vital" to finding 17-year-old Pheobe Bishop, who has been missing since she was last seen near Bundaberg Airport a week ago.

title.children: 'People don’t vanish': Police, family appeal for help to find missing teen

image.altText: Two women with sunglasses in the foreground and a man in the background

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old woman has been sentenced to seven and a half years in prison for setting a friend on fire after a night consuming drugs and alcohol.

title.children: Cheers as woman jailed for setting friend on fire while partying

image.altText: A photo is displayed on the big screens during Robert Walls Funeral Service at the MCG.

props.synopsis: A decorated player, a ruthless coach and an insightful media performer, Robert Walls is remembered as a "big softie" by his family.

title.children: 'A fortunate life': AFL giant Walls remembered at moving funeral service

image.altText: A police officer takes a picture of a road. He is holding a camera.

props.synopsis: The body was discovered on the side of the Princes Freeway in Morwell, about two hours south-east of Melbourne.

title.children: Police searching for driver who fatally struck Traralgon dad and drove away
